note.p: Education: Birmingham; Emmanuel College, Cambridge; University of Berlin. MA

Career: Fellow of Emmanuel College, Cambridge (1877-1906); Lecturer in Experimental Physics, Cambridge University (1887-1899); Director, Meteorological Office (1905-1920); Professor of Meteorology, Royal College of Science (1920-1924)
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1945-1948 vol 5 pp 203-230, plate, by E Gold
